Class arjuna.JavaSim.Distributions.RandomStream 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----arjuna.JavaSim.Distributions.RandomStream
public class RandomStream
extends Object
The class RandomStream is the base class from which the other distribution classes are derived. It uses a linear congruential generator based on the algorithm from "Algorithms", R. Sedgewick, Addison-Wesley, Reading MA, 1983 pp. 36-38. The results of the LC generator are shuffled with a multiplicative generator as suggested by Maclaren and Marsaglia (See Knuth Vol2, Seminumerical Algorithms). The multiplicative generator is courtesy I. Mitrani 1992, private correspondence: Y[i+1] = Y[i] * 5^5 mod 2^26, period is 2^24, initial seed must be odd

RandomStream()
RandomStream(long, long)

Error()
Returns a chi-square error measure on the uniform distribution function.
getNumber()
In derived classes this method returns the value obtained by the stream.

getNumber 
  public abstract double getNumber() throws IOException, ArithmeticException
In derived classes this method returns the value obtained by the stream. It must be redefined by the deriving class.

Returns a chi-square error measure on the uniform distribution function.
